ThingDef.label: Fueling Dispenser
ThingDef.description: A simple refueling machine capable of refueling all standard refuelable objects like generators, braziers, and mortars. It will attempt to fuel the output (yellow cell) with objects from the input (white cell).\n\n(Works with "refuelable comp" buildings and some others eg, SoS, CE.)

ThingDef.label: Smart hopper
ThingDef.description: An intelligent hopper which gathers objects within its input range (white cells). It can be toggled to only gather items in stockpiles. Does not push objects elsewhere, only gathers them, and will also grab from nearby belts. This device is unrelated to a nutrient dispenser hopper, and does not interface with a nutrient dispenser.

ThingDef.label: Growzone puller
ThingDef.description: A specialized puller that will pull from adjacent grow zones. It must be connected to the grow zone to function properly.

ThingDef.label: Item puller MKI
ThingDef.description: A device that pulls items from the input (white cell) and pushes them to the output (yellow cell). Turn it on after setting the filters.\nThis device is very flexible in its connections and works with Stockpiles, Storage, Belts (all versions), I/O, and others.

ThingDef.label: Item puller MKII
ThingDef.description: An optimized puller which runs at higher speeds. Pulls from input (white cell) to output (yellow cell). Very flexible in its connections.

ThingDef.label: Item angle puller
ThingDef.description: A specialized puller designed to pull items at a 90 degree angle. Functionally similar to normal puller. Directions can be swapped after placing.

ThingDef.label: Wall item puller
ThingDef.description: A specialized item puller that functions as a wall, pushing items from input (white cell) to output (yellow cell). The wall puller is insulated enough for use in freezers and secure enough for prisons.

ThingDef.label: Conveyor belt
ThingDef.description: An industrial grade assembly belt used for the transportation of items in a specific direction to a specific location. Useful for automatically hauling products without having your colonists do it themselves. It will dump into storage or stockpiles - or just leave stuff on the ground when the belts end. Because they are rather unsophisticated, they will happily dump whatever they have off the end if there is room.\nA corner can be made by leading the belt into the side of another belt and it will seamlessly continue.

ThingDef.label: Fast conveyor belt
ThingDef.description: An upgraded version of the conveyor belt which transports at twice the speed. Functions similarly to the standard belt, dumping into storage, stockpiles, or empty space.\nA corner can be made by leading the belt into the side of another belt and it will seamlessly continue.

ThingDef.label: Express conveyor belt
ThingDef.description: An advanced conveyor belt for optimal logistics, moving at three times the speed (or 1.5x its predecessor). Functions similarly to the standard belt, dumping into storage, stockpiles, or empty space.\nA corner can be made by leading the belt into the side of another belt and it will seamlessly continue.

ThingDef.label: Wall belt
ThingDef.description: Moves items - through walls! You can use these to traverse walls or move items along inside them. When items hit the end, they will move out onto the ground, as long as there is room.

ThingDef.label: Underground belt
ThingDef.description: Underground conveyor belts carry items in tunnels under the ground, safely under walls, machines, and other belts without connecting.\nDoes not require an entrance or exit unless merging with a standard above-ground belt.

ThingDef.label: Underground belt entrance
ThingDef.description: Connects ground conveyor belts to underground conveyors. This is the entrance to the subterranean passages.

ThingDef.label: Underground belt exit
ThingDef.description: Connects the underground conveyor belt to the above-ground conveyor. Provides an exit back to the surface and will drop items on the floor if there is no conveyor.

ThingDef.Name: PRF_Belt_Splitter
ThingDef.label: Conveyor splitter
ThingDef.description: An automated unit that directs items on a conveyor belt in different directions depending on filters, handled by a very basic AI. If no filters are set, it will simply split where items passing through go. Directions in settings are output, and must be enabled.

ThingDef.label: Underground splitter
ThingDef.description: A subterranean conveyor splitter. Functions similarly to an above ground splitter, minus the mess.

ThingDef.label: Wall splitter
ThingDef.description: A conveyor splitter built into the walls. Functions similarly to standard splitters, connecting to above ground belts.
